name: Mushroom Reproduction
description: The fruiting body of mushrooms vary greatly. In many cases the spores are emitted from the gills under a cap and are carried by the wind.
The Puffball Mushroom takes a very different approach to spreading spores. Click the annotation to learn more.

annotations.label: Puffball Fruitbody
description: The distinguishing feature of all puffballs is that they do not have an open cap with spore-bearing gills. Instead, spores are produced internally, in a spheroidal fruitbody.
The fruitbody remains closed until after the spores have been released from the basidia.

Eventually, it develops an aperture, or dries, becomes brittle, and splits, and the spores escape are fungi, so named because clouds of brown dust-like spores are emitted when the mature fruitbody bursts or is impacted.
